sen.e: The first part tells about the story of Fusasaki no Otodo (FUJIWARA no Fusasaki) who, on hearing his mother he had lost during childhood to have come from Shidotsu, Sanuki Province, visits there to perform religious rites for the repose of his mother's departed soul and meets a woman diver in the area who tells him that she is his mother and how she retrieved 'Menko huhai no tama' (an oval treasure that is aesthetic from any angle) which was stolen by the Palace of the Dragon King; and there is aikyogen (comic interlude in Noh) where an inhabitant of Shidotsu recounts the story that was told in the first part; and the latter part is where Fusasaki's mother appears as Ryunyo (a form that a woman must turn into in order to rest in peace) and thanks Fusasaki for holding a mass while Fusasaki was performing a memorial service in honor of her mother with Myohorenge-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra).
